meanings.definition: Capable of being obtained or acquired.
meanings.sent1: The toy was getable at the store.
meanings.sent2: The book on the shelf was getable for anyone to borrow.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying car seemed getable to the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming an astronaut felt as getable as reaching for the stars.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to travel the world was so getable, she could almost touch it.

meanings.definition: Able to be reached or accessed.
meanings.sent1: The top shelf was not getable for the little boy.
meanings.sent2: The information on the website was easily getable for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the fishbowl was getable, but it was out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The key to success felt as getable as the key to the locked door.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map made the hidden chest seem so getable, yet so far away.

meanings.sent1: With hard work, good grades are getable for all students.
meanings.sent2: The goal of running a marathon was getable with proper training.
meanings.sent3: The idea of winning the lottery seemed getable, but unlikely.
meanings.sent4: The dream of owning a house felt as getable as building a sandcastle.
meanings.sent5: The championship trophy was so getable, they could almost taste victory.
